definition: (of an expanse of water) vast/distant and indistinct/tiny or insignificant

sentences.english: Oscillating along the track of time, we sea our insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 擺盪在時間的軌跡，個人者發現自己何其渺小。

sentences.english: We are so small the universe of a.
sentences.chinese: 我們是這個大千世界如此渺小的一員。

sentences.english: Our life is so chickenshit in the historical river.
sentences.chinese: 生命在歷史長河中是如此的渺小。

sentences.english: Lives, is extraordinary small just like ants.
That is incapable and is tiny , my heart , a gloominess .
sentences.chinese: 那份無力和渺小，我的心，一片灰暗。

sentences.english: It is dark and my cap lamp is a tiny candle in a cavern.
sentences.chinese: 非常的黑暗，在洞裏我安全帽的頭燈就像渺小的蠟燭。

sentences.english: The least of man's original emanation is better than the best of borrowed thought.
sentences.chinese: 人最渺小的原創火花也比最優秀的拾人牙慧要強。

sentences.english: You can make it as small as a mustard seed or let it expand limitlessly.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把它變成如芥子般的渺小，或者放寬至無限大。

sentences.english: So time became lumbersome and little, snowstorms broke the door of the heart easily.
sentences.chinese: 於是時間變得沉重而渺小，暴風雪輕易破了薄薄的門。

sentences.english: I never look at the stars but I think how little I am.
sentences.chinese: 我每次看星星必然會想自己是多麼渺小。

sentences.english: Hehe, how does tiny-weny chicken defeat a gigantic dinosaur for twice?Fair enough.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，渺小的公雞怎麼兩次戰敗龐大的恐龍？

sentences.english: In view of our two big populations, the figures are too small.
sentences.chinese: 相對於兩國龐大的人口基數，這些數字顯得渺小。

sentences.english: The height of the Empire State Building belittles the houses around it.
sentences.chinese: 帝國大廈的高度使它周遭的房屋顯得渺小。

sentences.english: We see a humbling yet beautiful view of ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我們看見了自己渺小又美麗的樣子。

sentences.english: I feel most insignificant in the presence of these devotees.
sentences.chinese: 在你們這些奉獻者面前，我感到自己極其的渺小。

sentences.english: She goes through the small stone bridge, so slight, chasing her little care.
sentences.chinese: 人在小石橋上走過，渺小的追一點子想念。

definition: small and weak/puny/the small and weak/children/women and children
lit. mole cricket and ants/fig. tiny individuals with no power
every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
